item.title: Encryption of private data with EncFS
item.description: What’s EncFS ? Let’s hear it from the mouth of Wikipedia EncFS is a Free (LGPL) FUSE-based cryptographic filesystem. It transparently encrypts files, using an arbitrary directory as storage for the encrypted files. So what does EncFS do ? It simply takes a base directory that’s encrypted using a key and mounts a virtual filesystem on another folder. Why would you use it ? I personally use EncFS to protect some private data on my external hard drives.
